body:
The current logic for syncing headers may lead to lots of duplicate `getheaders` requests being sent:  If a new block arrives while the node is in headers sync, it will send `getheaders` in response to the block announcement.  When the headers arrive, the message will be of maximum size and so a follow-up request will be sent---all of that in addition to the existing headers syncing.  This will create a second "chain" of `getheaders` requests.  If more blocks arrive, this may even lead to arbitrarily many parallel chains of redundant requests.  (See https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/6755.)

This patch changes the behaviour to only request more headers after a maximum-sized message when it contained at least one unknown header.  This avoids sustaining parallel chains of redundant requests.

Note that this patch avoids the issues raised in the discussion of https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6821:  There is no risk of the node being permanently blocked.  At the latest when a new block arrives this will trigger a new getheaders request and restart syncing.
title: net: Avoid duplicate getheaders requests.
